intro: Seringia adenogyna, commonly known as the smooth seringia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub with narrow, grey-green leaves and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Its botanical features include a woody stem and the ability to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments. Seringia adenogyna is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
